Is there a hook that fires when you push? And preferably fires for
each commit to be pushed...

This would be beautiful, but I doubt Git supports it. Maybe we should
consider adding it, it would be a nice feature.
Csaba Hoch — <hh/978> <↑hh/977> (2009-11-29) 
> Is there a hook that fires when you push?

Yes, the hook is called "update" [1].

> And preferably fires for each commit to be pushed...
> This would be beautiful, but I doubt Git supports it. Maybe we should
> consider adding it, it would be a nice feature.

It seemed to me that you can do anything in a commit hook, even things
like examining each commit to be pushed separately. It's just that
it's not trivial...

[1] http://ftp.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/v1.5.3.8/hooks.html
